elements.content: The 3D polymeric complex {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]·(2H3O)+}n (DPT = dipentum = 3, 3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzoic carboxylic), DMF = N, N′- dimenthyl formamide) with binuclear cadmium as building block was obtained from hydrothermal reaction of CdCl2·4H2O with medicine dipentum sodium. CCDC No. 621682.
elements.clean_text: The 3D polymeric complex {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]⋅(2H3O)+}n (DPT = dipentum = 3, 3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzoic carboxylic), DMF = N, N'- dimenthyl formamide) with binuclear cadmium as building block was obtained from hydrothermal reaction of CdCl2⋅4H2O with medicine dipentum sodium. CCDC No. 621682.

elements.content: Each Cd8DPT8 grids are joined together through sharing the cadmium apics to give a two-dimensional structure consisting of rhombus grids with dimensions of 14.72 × 12.97 Å based on metal-metal distances. The most interesting of the structure is that the diagonal of basic grids also joined by the DPT ligands.
elements.clean_text: Each Cd8DPT8 grids are joined together through sharing the cadmium apics to give a two-dimensional structure consisting of rhombus grids with dimensions of 14.72 × 12.97 Å based on metal-metal distances. The most interesting of the structure is that the diagonal of basic grids also joined by the DPT ligands.

elements.content: Because of their interesting properties and potential applications in functional materials, the synthesis of organic−inorganic open framework complexes has received considerable interest in the past decade. Coordination polymers contain multidendate benzenecarboxylate as bridging ligands have especially attracted much attention because of their wide application in catalysis, separation, gas storage, and molecular recognition. A multidentate benzene carboxylate ligand is capable of forming infinite connections with metal atoms through oxygen atoms of its carboxyl groups and adopts versatile coordination modes.
elements.clean_text: Because of their interesting properties and potential applications in functional materials, the synthesis of organic-inorganic open framework complexes has received considerable interest in the past decade. Coordination polymers contain multidendate benzenecarboxylate as bridging ligands have especially attracted much attention because of their wide application in catalysis, separation, gas storage, and molecular recognition. A multidentate benzene carboxylate ligand is capable of forming infinite connections with metal atoms through oxygen atoms of its carboxyl groups and adopts versatile coordination modes.

elements.content: Our current studies are focused on the generation of polymeric structures in metal dicarboxylate-like complexes by medicine dipentum ligand (3,3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzoic acid), a leechdom (as shown in Scheme ) that has been widely used to prevent and treat inflammatory bowel disease, such as ulcerative colitis. In previous work, we have reported the structures of a serial of Mn, Cd, Co, Ca, and Mg complexes of dipentum; however, all of them are one-dimensional structures. Also, we have reported a 3D diamondoid-like Cd coordination polymer with 3,3′-azodibenzoic acid as building block; all the carboxylic groups in the ligands adopt the same bidentate chelating coordination modes. Recent studies have shown that the variation of reaction condition regarding the type of bridging units and the conformational preference as well as the metal ions employed and their counterions, has a profound influences on the polymeric structures obtained. As part of our systematic work, in this paper, we will report the hydrothermal reaction of dipentum with CdCl2·4H2O, which yields a novel interesting three-dimensional coordination polymers 1 {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]·(2H3O)+} n . The coordination behavior in title complex is totally different from the structures we reported before.
elements.clean_text: Our current studies are focused on the generation of polymeric structures in metal dicarboxylate-like complexes by medicine dipentum ligand (3,3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzoic acid), a leechdom (as shown in Scheme ) that has been widely used to prevent and treat inflammatory bowel disease, such as ulcerative colitis. In previous work, we have reported the structures of a serial of Mn, Cd, Co, Ca, and Mg complexes of dipentum; however, all of them are one-dimensional structures. Also, we have reported a 3D diamondoid-like Cd coordination polymer with 3,3'-azodibenzoic acid as building block; all the carboxylic groups in the ligands adopt the same bidentate chelating coordination modes. Recent studies have shown that the variation of reaction condition regarding the type of bridging units and the conformational preference as well as the metal ions employed and their counterions, has a profound influences on the polymeric structures obtained. As part of our systematic work, in this paper, we will report the hydrothermal reaction of dipentum with CdCl2⋅4H2O, which yields a novel interesting three-dimensional coordination polymers 1 {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]⋅(2H3O)+} n . The coordination behavior in title complex is totally different from the structures we reported before.

<title>Structure of DPT Ligand</title>

elements.clean_text: 1  Structure of DPT Ligand

elements.content: Title compound {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]·(2H3O)} n was prepared by treatment of ligand dipentum sodium (0.346 g, 1 mmol), CdCl2·4H2O (0.255 g 1 mmol), under hydrothermal reaction conditions. The IR spectrum of title compounds display three strong absorptions at 1623, 1482, 1382 cm−1, which is due to the characteristic νas (COO) and νs (COO) stretching modes of carboxyl groups. This assignment is well in agreement with the vast literature on the IR spectroscopy of carboxylic groups. The peak at around 1700 cm−1 was observed, indicating that the amide group is present in complex. A broad peak at 3418 cm−1 observed in complex 1 suggests coordinating water molecule in existence.
elements.clean_text: Title compound {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]⋅(2H3O)} n  was prepared by treatment of ligand dipentum sodium (0.346 g, 1 mmol), CdCl2⋅4H2O (0.255 g 1 mmol), under hydrothermal reaction conditions. The IR spectrum of title compounds display three strong absorptions at 1623, 1482, 1382 cm-1, which is due to the characteristic νas (COO) and νs (COO) stretching modes of carboxyl groups. This assignment is well in agreement with the vast literature on the IR spectroscopy of carboxylic groups. The peak at around 1700 cm-1 was observed, indicating that the amide group is present in complex. A broad peak at 3418 cm-1 observed in complex 1 suggests coordinating water molecule in existence.

elements.content: The three-dimensional polymeric structure of 1 was revealed by a single-crystal X-ray (0.71073 Å) diffraction study. Crystallographic data of 1 indicate that 1 belongs to the monoclinic crystal system, having the space group C2/m and Z = 4. The local coordination environments around the cadmium atoms can be best described as a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism composed by five monodentate carboxylic groups of different dipentum ligands and three oxygen atoms from DMF (as shown in Figure ). All the Cd−O distances range from 2.359(6) to 2.451(6) Å in complex 1, similar to that found in other eight-coordinated Cd(II) complexes.
elements.clean_text: The three-dimensional polymeric structure of 1 was revealed by a single-crystal X-ray (0.71073 Å) diffraction study. Crystallographic data of 1  indicate that 1 belongs to the monoclinic crystal system, having the space group C2/m and Z = 4. The local coordination environments around the cadmium atoms can be best described as a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism composed by five monodentate carboxylic groups of different dipentum ligands and three oxygen atoms from DMF (as shown in Figure ). All the Cd-O distances range from 2.359(6) to 2.451(6) Å in complex 1, similar to that found in other eight-coordinated Cd(II) complexes.

elements.content: Polyhedral representation of 1 shows the local coordination geometry around Cd; the center shows a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism (Cd, black; O, red; N, blue; and C, black). Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (deg) are as follows: Cd(1)−O(1), 2.360(6); Cd(1)−O(1A), 2.360(6); Cd(1)−O(7), 2.374(5); Cd(1)−O(7A), 2.375(5); Cd(1)−O(5)), 2.380(7); Cd(1)−O(6), 2.387(9); Cd(1)−O(8), 2.452)(7); Cd(1)−O(8A), 2.452(6);O1−Cd(1)−O(1A), 73.0(4); O1−Cd(1)−O(7), 76.7(2); O1−Cd(1)−O(7A), 119.1(2); O(1A)−Cd(1)−O(7), 119.1(2);O(1A)−Cd(1)−O(7A),76.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(7A), 74.0(3); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(5), 79.7(2); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(5A), 79.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(5),142.97(16); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(5A), 142.97(16); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(6), 143.35(18); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(6A), 143.35(18); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(6),78.0(3); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(6A), 78.0(3);O(5)−Cd(1)−O(6), 106.4(3); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(8), 143.5(2); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(8A),76.0(3); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(8), 136.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(8A),70.7(2); O(5)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.2(2); O(6A)−Cd(1)−O(8),70.8(2); O(1a)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.0(3); O(1A)−Cd1 O(8A), 143.5(2); O(7A)−Cd(1)−O(8), 70.7(2); O(7A)-Cd(1)−O(8),136.7(2); O(5A)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.2(2); O(6A)−Cd(1)−O(8),70.8(2); O(8a)−Cd(1)−O(8), 123.1(4). Symmetry codes are as follows: (A) −x, −y, −z + 1; (B) −x, y, −z + 1; (C) x, −y, z; (D) −x + 1, −y, −z + 2; (E) −x − 1/2, −y + 1/2, −z + 1.

Interestingly, the dipentum ligands in complex 1 can be classified as two types according to the coordination mode of carboxylic group. Part of them acting as a tetradentate bridging spacer (each carboxylic group coordinates two Cd atoms through monodentate mode) links four different Cd atoms. The additional oxygen atoms of the carboxylic groups also bonded to another different Cd atom through forming coedge eight-member rings such as Cd1−O7A−C3A−O1A−Cd1A−O7C−C3C−O1C−Cd1 and Cd1−O7−C3−O1−Cd1A−O7B−C3B−O1B−Cd1 (as shown in Figure ), thus resulting in formation of a binuclear framework. The binuclear cadmium subunits are further cross-linked by the molecular skeletons of the dipentum ligands in an end-to-end mode, thereby extending the structure into a 3D open network (Figure ). Another type of dipentum ligands acting as bidentate bridging spacer (each carboxylic group of the ligand acting as monodentate mode coordinates one cadmium atom) also can be found in title complex. The ratio between above two kinds of dipentum ligand is 2: 1. So the whole binuclear cadmium unit is made of three dipentum ligands, six DMF molecules, and outside of each binuclear unit, two H3O+ ions that maintain the electric charge balance.
elements.clean_text: Interestingly, the dipentum ligands in complex 1 can be classified as two types according to the coordination mode of carboxylic group. Part of them acting as a tetradentate bridging spacer (each carboxylic group coordinates two Cd atoms through monodentate mode) links four different Cd atoms. The additional oxygen atoms of the carboxylic groups also bonded to another different Cd atom through forming coedge eight-member rings such as Cd1-O7A-C3A-O1A-Cd1A-O7C-C3C-O1C-Cd1 and Cd1-O7-C3-O1-Cd1A-O7B-C3B-O1B-Cd1 (as shown in Figure ), thus resulting in formation of a binuclear framework. The binuclear cadmium subunits are further cross-linked by the molecular skeletons of the dipentum ligands in an end-to-end mode, thereby extending the structure into a 3D open network (Figure ). Another type of dipentum ligands acting as bidentate bridging spacer (each carboxylic group of the ligand acting as monodentate mode coordinates one cadmium atom) also can be found in title complex. The ratio between above two kinds of dipentum ligand is 2: 1. So the whole binuclear cadmium unit is made of three dipentum ligands, six DMF molecules, and outside of each binuclear unit, two H3O+ ions that maintain the electric charge balance.

elements.content: Perspective of coedge eight-member rings linked by double cadmium atoms, only Cd, O, α-carbon atoms are shown.
elements.clean_text: 2  Perspective of coedge eight-member rings linked by double cadmium atoms, only Cd, O, α-carbon atoms are shown.

elements.content: 3D open network of the title complex.

elements.content: Different from the title complex, we have already reported a 3D diamondoid-like Cd coordination polymer with 3,3′ -azodibenzoic acid as building block; all the carboxylic in those ligands adopt the same bidentate chelating coordination modes. To the best of our knowledge, few 3D cadmium complexes containing two such kinds of coordination behavior in carboxylic groups have been reported.
elements.clean_text: Different from the title complex, we have already reported a 3D diamondoid-like Cd coordination polymer with 3,3' -azodibenzoic acid as building block; all the carboxylic in those ligands adopt the same bidentate chelating coordination modes. To the best of our knowledge, few 3D cadmium complexes containing two such kinds of coordination behavior in carboxylic groups have been reported.

elements.content: As depicted in Figure , a perspective of 1 along the c-axis with the 3,3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzene) ligand simplified for clarity, reveals a 2D sheet framework. The gridlike Cd8DPT8 species can be viewed as the basic building block of the structure (as shown in Scheme ), in which the apexes are occupied by two cadmium ions and the sides are formed by DPT− ligands. Each Cd8DPT8 grid is joined together through sharing the cadmium apics to give a two-dimensional structure consisting of rhombus grids with dimensions of 14.72 × 12.97 Å2 based on metal−metal distances. The most interesting things about the structure is that the diagonal of the basic grids is also joined by the DPT ligands, totally different from previously reported gridlike structures, in which the basic grids are diamondoid-like. A perspective viewed along the b-axis of 1 shows that the structure consists of an irregular net, which through AA-type stacking (Figure ) forms an infinite 2D gridlike structure.
elements.clean_text: As depicted in Figure , a perspective of 1 along the c-axis with the 3,3-azo-bis (6-hydroxybenzene) ligand simplified for clarity, reveals a 2D sheet framework. The gridlike Cd8DPT8 species can be viewed as the basic building block of the structure (as shown in Scheme ), in which the apexes are occupied by two cadmium ions and the sides are formed by DPT- ligands. Each Cd8DPT8 grid is joined together through sharing the cadmium apics to give a two-dimensional structure consisting of rhombus grids with dimensions of 14.72 × 12.97 Å2 based on metal-metal distances. The most interesting things about the structure is that the diagonal of the basic grids is also joined by the DPT ligands, totally different from previously reported gridlike structures, in which the basic grids are diamondoid-like. A perspective viewed along the b-axis of 1 shows that the structure consists of an irregular net, which through AA-type stacking (Figure ) forms an infinite 2D gridlike structure.

elements.content: To study the thermal stability of title compound, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was performed on their polycrystalline samples (as shown in Figure ). For compound 1, there are four obvious weight-loss steps for the removal of coordinated molecules. First, one strikingly clean weight-loss step occurred at ca. 60−67 °C (4.4% loss), corresponding to the removal of two water molecules per formula unit (4.10% calcd). Second, another obvious weight loss (9.01%) happened at ca. 114−117 °C, which indicates 1/3 coordinated DMF (8.93%) molecule in complex 1 was removed. Third, a clear weight loss (18.7%) between 255 and 363 °C suggests that the additional (2/3) DMF molecules (17.9%) vaporized. Lastly, a large weight loss (44.3%) that happened at ca. 365−522 °C shows that the DPT ligands are removed from the complex.

Second, another obvious weight loss (9.01%) happened at ca. 114-117 °C, which indicates 1/3 coordinated DMF (8.93%) molecule in complex 1 was removed. Third, a clear weight loss (18.7%) between 255 and 363 °C suggests that the additional (2/3) DMF molecules (17.9%) vaporized. Lastly, a large weight loss (44.3%) that happened at ca. 365-522 °C shows that the DPT ligands are removed from the complex.

elements.content: In conclusion, we have successfully synthesized a novel three-dimensional coordination polymer based on gridlike subunit Cd8DPT8 as building block under hydrothermal conditions. The polymeric complex {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]·(2H3O)+} n exhibits an unprecedented topological structure.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In conclusion, we have successfully synthesized a novel three-dimensional coordination polymer based on gridlike subunit Cd8DPT8 as building block under hydrothermal conditions. The polymeric complex {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]⋅(2H3O)+} n  exhibits an unprecedented topological structure.

elements.content:
The authorship in this paper was changed from the previous version posted ASAP on May 20, 2008. A new version was posted on June 4, 2008.

References

Teflon-lined Parr bombs containing a mixture of dipentum sodium (0.346 g, 1 mmol), CdCl2·4H2O (0.255 g 1 mmol), water (10 mL), and DMF (5 mL) were placed inside an oven at 160 °C. The beautiful golden block-like crystals for 1 were obtained after 48 h of heating. Yield: 0.499 g (61%) on the basis of dipentum sodium. Calcd for C30H36CdN6O14: C, 44.06; H, 4.41. Found: C, 44.03; H, 4.49. IR (KBr, cm−1) 3418(m), 1623(s), 1590(s), 1565(vs), 1519(w), 1482(s), 1436(vs), 1382(s), 1299(m), 1105(w), 923(w), 840(s), 817(w), 792(m), 725(m), 685(m), 592(w), 474(w).

References

Teflon-lined Parr bombs containing a mixture of dipentum sodium (0.346 g, 1 mmol), CdCl2⋅4H2O (0.255 g 1 mmol), water (10 mL), and DMF (5 mL) were placed inside an oven at 160 °C. cln_elements.content:
The three-dimensional polymeric structure of 1 was revealed by a single-crystal X-ray (0.71073 Å) diffraction study. Crystallographic data of 1 indicate that 1 belongs to the monoclinic crystal system, having the space group C2/m and Z = 4. The local coordination environments around the cadmium atoms can be best described as a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism composed by five monodentate carboxylic groups of different dipentum ligands and three oxygen atoms from DMF (as shown in Figure ). All the Cd−O distances range from 2.359(6) to 2.451(6) Å in complex 1, similar to that found in other eight-coordinated Cd(II) complexes.

To study the thermal stability of title compound, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was performed on their polycrystalline samples (as shown in Figure ). For compound 1, there are four obvious weight-loss steps for the removal of coordinated molecules. First, one strikingly clean weight-loss step occurred at ca. 60−67 °C (4.4% loss), corresponding to the removal of two water molecules per formula unit (4.10% calcd). Second, another obvious weight loss (9.01%) happened at ca. 114−117 °C, which indicates 1/3 coordinated DMF (8.93%) molecule in complex 1 was removed. Third, a clear weight loss (18.7%) between 255 and 363 °C suggests that the additional (2/3) DMF molecules (17.9%) vaporized. Lastly, a large weight loss (44.3%) that happened at ca. 365−522 °C shows that the DPT ligands are removed from the complex.

Crystal data for {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]·(2H3O)} n (1): C30H36CdN6O14, monoclinic, C2/c, M = 817.1, a = 24.361(5) Å, b = 15.388(4) Å, c = 11.609(3) Å, 118.460(17), V = 3825.9(16) Å3, Z = 4, D c = 1.418 g cm−3, u = 0.640 mm−1, R1 = 0.0446, wR2 = 0.1227 (5074 reflections), T = 293 K, S = 1.053.

The three-dimensional polymeric structure of 1 was revealed by a single-crystal X-ray (0.71073 Å) diffraction study. Crystallographic data of 1  indicate that 1 belongs to the monoclinic crystal system, having the space group C2/m and Z = 4. The local coordination environments around the cadmium atoms can be best described as a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism composed by five monodentate carboxylic groups of different dipentum ligands and three oxygen atoms from DMF (as shown in Figure ). All the Cd-O distances range from 2.359(6) to 2.451(6) Å in complex 1, similar to that found in other eight-coordinated Cd(II) complexes. 

To study the thermal stability of title compound, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was performed on their polycrystalline samples (as shown in Figure ). For compound 1, there are four obvious weight-loss steps for the removal of coordinated molecules. First, one strikingly clean weight-loss step occurred at ca. 60-67 °C (4.4% loss), corresponding to the removal of two water molecules per formula unit (4.10% calcd). Second, another obvious weight loss (9.01%) happened at ca. 114-117 °C, which indicates 1/3 coordinated DMF (8.93%) molecule in complex 1 was removed. Third, a clear weight loss (18.7%) between 255 and 363 °C suggests that the additional (2/3) DMF molecules (17.9%) vaporized. Lastly, a large weight loss (44.3%) that happened at ca. 365-522 °C shows that the DPT ligands are removed from the complex.

Crystal data for {[Cd2(DPT)3(DMF)6]⋅(2H3O)} n  (1): C30H36CdN6O14, monoclinic, C2/c, M = 817.1, a = 24.361(5) Å, b = 15.388(4) Å, c = 11.609(3) Å, 118.460(17), V = 3825.9(16) Å3, Z = 4, D c = 1.418 g cm-3, u = 0.640 mm-1, R1 = 0.0446, wR2 = 0.1227 (5074 reflections), T = 293 K, S = 1.053.

decomposition temperature.type: removal of two water molecules per formula unit

</fig>

Polyhedral representation of 1 shows the local coordination geometry around Cd; the center shows a slightly distorted tetragonal antiprism (Cd, black; O, red; N, blue; and C, black). Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (deg) are as follows: Cd(1)−O(1), 2.360(6); Cd(1)−O(1A), 2.360(6); Cd(1)−O(7), 2.374(5); Cd(1)−O(7A), 2.375(5); Cd(1)−O(5)), 2.380(7); Cd(1)−O(6), 2.387(9); Cd(1)−O(8), 2.452)(7); Cd(1)−O(8A), 2.452(6);O1−Cd(1)−O(1A), 73.0(4); O1−Cd(1)−O(7), 76.7(2); O1−Cd(1)−O(7A), 119.1(2); O(1A)−Cd(1)−O(7), 119.1(2);O(1A)−Cd(1)−O(7A),76.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(7A), 74.0(3); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(5), 79.7(2); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(5A), 79.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(5),142.97(16); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(5A), 142.97(16); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(6), 143.35(18); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(6A), 143.35(18); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(6),78.0(3); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(6A), 78.0(3);O(5)−Cd(1)−O(6), 106.4(3); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(8), 143.5(2); O(1)−Cd(1)−O(8A),76.0(3); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(8), 136.7(2); O(7)−Cd(1)−O(8A),70.7(2); O(5)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.2(2); O(6A)−Cd(1)−O(8),70.8(2); O(1a)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.0(3); O(1A)−Cd1 O(8A), 143.5(2); O(7A)−Cd(1)−O(8), 70.7(2); O(7A)-Cd(1)−O(8),136.7(2); O(5A)−Cd(1)−O(8), 76.2(2); O(6A)−Cd(1)−O(8),70.8(2); O(8a)−Cd(1)−O(8), 123.1(4). Symmetry codes are as follows: (A) −x, −y, −z + 1; (B) −x, y, −z + 1; (C) x, −y, z; (D) −x + 1, −y, −z + 2; (E) −x − 1/2, −y + 1/2, −z + 1.
Perspective of coedge eight-member rings linked by double cadmium atoms, only Cd, O, α-carbon atoms are shown.
